title: Interactive Geographic Information Science (GIS) Microlearning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic spatial concepts and ability to use mobile devices
context.additional_context: An interactive learning environment emphasizing workplace applicability for current practitioners. Utilizing open resources based on ETSS (Effective Teaching, Learning, and Assessment)

learning_goals: Learners will be able to perform basic GIS analysis (coordinate system conversion, spatial queries) with over 80% accuracy using mobile devices.
Learners will be able to design learning activities that solve real-world spatial problems (e.g., traffic route optimization) through interactive simulations.
Learners will be able to create and share spatial data visualizations (e.g., heatmaps) tailored to corporate requirements at least three times.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
